summary:
This mod aims to add lore friendly purchasable (and also decorable/upgradable) houses in all the towns where you couldn\'t own one before.
As in vanilla houses, you have to become thane of the city you want to purchase the house in but it won\'t be a requirement everywhere.
descriptionHtml:
-Missing houses-

[size=4][b]Introduction[/b][/size]
This mod aims to add lore friendly purchasable (and also decorable/upgradable) houses in all the towns where you couldn\'t own one before.
As in vanilla houses, you have to become thane of the city you want to purchase the house in but it won\'t be a requirement everywhere.

[size=4][b]Languages[/b][/size]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/20204] German (By Ghaunadaur) [/url]

[size=4][b]Updates[/b][/size]

[b]0.25[/b]:
[list]
[*]New house added: Rustenrose (Morthal).
[*]New decor: [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=17423] Paintings [/url] Added.
[*]New decor: More lights in Trinsmardia\'s housecarl\'s room.
[/list]

[b]0.2[/b]:
[list]
[*]Fixed bug: Stewards no longer take \"extra\" money from you when purchasing a house.
[*]Fixed bug: You can no longer put \"infinite\" weapons/shields on a weapon plaque.
[*]Fixed bug: Weapon plaque is now placed correctly in Neveice.
[*]Fixed bug: You can no longer buy Trinsmardia with less than 6000 Gold.
[*]Fixed bug: You can now tell that you can\'t afford to buy Trinsmardia.
[*]New house added: Coldenia (Dawnstar).
[*]New upgrade: Possibility to build a blacksmith area in Coldenia.
[/list]

[b]0.1b-e[/b]: 
[list]
[*]Fixed bug: Missing .bsa
[*]Fixed bug: Files missing in .bsa
[*]New decor: Fire with Clothes iron added to Trinsmardia\'s basement.
[/list]

[b]0.1[/b]:
[list]
[*]New house added: Trinsmardia (Falkreath).
[*]New house added: Neveice (Winterhold).
[/list]


[size=4][b]Houses[/b][/size]
[b][color=red]-Neveice-[/color][/b]
[img]http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/17830-1-1338272800.jpg[/img]
A new built house located in Winterhold, it could be the very first step to the rebuilt of Winterhold.
Neveice is the smallest and cheapest house in all Skyrim, so it may be ideal for those
who want to live alone and can\'t afford a bigger home.
Even though it\'s not big, it features everything you may need in your home, from an
alchemy area to an enchanter area and you\'re free to display your items in any way you want
from display cases to weapon racks.

[u]Location[/u]: Winterhold
[u]Housecarl[/u]: None
[u]Home and decorations Purchased From[/u]: Malur Seloth
[u]Cost[/u]: 2,000 Gold
[u]Total Cost of all decorations[/u]: 2,150 Gold
[u]Total Cost of all upgrades[/u]: No upgrades
[u]Do I have to be thane to purchase it?[/u]: [color=red]Yes![/color]

[b]Decorations list:[/b]
[u]Kitchen furnishings[/u] (150 gold):
1 Cooking pot
1 Barrel (with food)
1 Sack (with food)
2 Chairs

[u]Bedroom Furnishings[/u] (200 gold):
1 Dresser
2 Paintings
1 Display case
1 Bed
1 End table

[u]Living room furnishings[/u] (300 gold):
1 Cupboard
1 Weapon plaque
1 Small table
2 Chairs

[u]Alchemy Laboratory[/u] (500 gold):
1 Alchemy lab
1 Shelf (with ingredients)
1 Table
1 Wall shelf (with potions)
1 Strongbox
1 Chest

[u]Enchanting Area[/u] (1000 gold):
1 Arcane Enchanter
1 Bookshelf
1 Crate (With soulgem fragments)
2 Gemholders (with gems)
4 Weapon racks
1 Mannequins
1 Chest

[u]Total features[/u]: Alchemy laboratory and Enchanting area with:
Weapon racks: 4
Mannequins: 1
Bookshelves: 1
Display case: 1
Weapon plaques: 1
Storage spaces: 8

[b][color=red]-Trinsmardia-[/color][/b]
[img]http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/17830-1-1338273563.jpg[/img]
It\'s located in Falkreath in front of the graveyard.
Trinsmardia is built (sort of) inside a cliff and besides the graveyard it features
a pleasant view of the river which flows just behind the house.
The house is two-stories, it would be smaller than Breezehome if not for its big basement which hosts also a guest room.
It features a decent amount of storage space (as much as Proudspire Manor) and both an Enchanting area and an alchemy laboratory.

[u]Location[/u]: Falkreath
[u]Housecarl[/u]: Taril (Woodelf)
[u]Home and decorations Purchased From[/u]: Nenya or Tekla
[u]Cost[/u]: 6,000 Gold
[u]Total Cost of all decorations[/u]: 4,200 Gold
[u]Total Cost of all upgrades[/u]: No upgrades
[u]Do I have to be thane to purchase it?[/u]: [color=red]Yes![/color]

[b]Decorations list:[/b]
[u]Kitchen furnishings[/u] (400 gold):
3 Hanging Pheasants
1 Cooking pot
2 baskets (with food)
2 sacks (with food)

[u]Bedroom Furnishings[/u] (400 gold):
1 Dresser
2 Paintings
1 Bookshelf
1 Table
2 Chairs
1 Weapon plaque

[u]Living room furnishings[/u] (300 gold):
1 Mannequin
1 Display case
1 Weapon plaque
1 larger table
2 chairs

[u]Alchemy Laboratory[/u] (600 gold):
1 Alchemy lab
1 Bookshelf
1 Shelf (with ingredients)
1 Crate (with ingredients)
1 Chair
1 Small table
2 barrels
1 Chest

[u]Enchanting Area[/u] (2500 gold):
1 Arcane Enchanter
1 Bookshelf
1 Crate (With soulgem fragments)
2 WallShelves (With two weapons)
6 Gemholders (with gems)
6 Weapon racks
2 Mannequins
1 Chest

[u]Total features[/u]: Alchemy laboratory and Enchanting area with:
Weapon racks: 6
Mannequins: 3
Bookshelves: 3
Display case: 1
Weapon plaques: 2
Storage spaces: 15

[b][color=red]-Coldenia-[/color][/b]
[img]http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/17830-1-1338527308.jpg[/img]
An abandoned house which is more or less in good conditions only because the owners
suddenly dissapared recently, not knowning their whereabouts it has been decided to put
the house for sale knowing an already discretely decorated and semi-clean house 
surrounded with a veil of mistery would surely attract a costumer.
Perhaps you\'ll find more clues about the previous owners inside your new home.
*More and different description after I\'ll decide and put the decorations*

[u]Location[/u]: Dawnstar
[u]Housecarl[/u]: None
[u]Home, decorations and upgrades Purchased From[/u]: Madena
[u]Cost[/u]: 3,500 Gold
[u]Total Cost of all upgrades[/u]: 6,000 Gold
[u]Total Cost of all decorations[/u]: No decorations yet
[u]Do I have to be thane to purchase it?[/u]: [color=red]No![/color]

[b]Upgrades list:[/b]
[u]Blacksmith area[/u]:
-Expands the house (indoor and outdoor)
1 Grindstone
1 Workbench
1 Forge
1 Anvil
1 Tanning rack

[b]Decorations list:[/b]
[u]No decorations yet[/u].

[b][color=red]-Rustenrose-[/color][/b]
[img]http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/17830-1-1338942957.jpg[/img]
You decided to rebuild the burned house in Morthal to start living there (...)
*Full description yet to write*

[u]Location[/u]: Morthal
[u]Housecarl[/u]: Melissa
[u]Home and decorations Purchased From[/u]: Morthal\'s jarl (Temporary)
[u]Cost[/u]: 3,000 Gold
[u]Total Cost of all decorations[/u]: 3,500 Gold
[u]Total Cost of all upgrades[/u]: No upgrades
[u]Requirements to purchase[/u]: [color=red]Must complete \"Laid to rest\" quest.[/color]

[b]Decorations list:[/b]
[u]Kitchen furnishings[/u] (500 gold):
1 Small round table
1 Chair
1 Cooking pot
2 barrels (with mead)
2 sacks (with food)
1 Bookshelf

[u]Bedroom furnishings[/u] (500 gold):
1 Single bed
2 Paintings
2 Chests
1 Dresser
1 Basket

[u]Laboratory[/u] (2500 gold):
1 Table
1 Enchanting workbench
1 Alchemy workbench
4 Mannequins
1 Satchel

[u]Total features[/u]: Alchemy and Enchanting laboratory with:
Weapon racks: 0
Mannequins: 4
Bookshelves: 1
Display case: 0
Weapon plaques: 0
Storage spaces: 8

[size=4][b]Compatibility[/b][/size]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=11616] Winterhold Restoration [/url]:
Load it AFTER missing houses, It will simply \"overwrite\" my player house and will be compatible.

This mod is NOT compatible with:
[list]
[*]Mods that add player houses in the same spot as mine [If they\'re in the same city but in different spots then it IS compatible].
[*]Mods that alter/rebuild cities in which the player houses are located in [They would still work but could be misplaced]
[*]Mods that edit the House Purchase script and favor scripts.
[/list]

If you have any other compatibility problem and you\'re sure it\'s because of my mod, please leave a comment, thanks!

[size=4][b]Installation[/b][/size]
1. Extract the file(s) from the .zip you just downloaded;
2. Move the Missing Houses.esp and Missing Houses.bsa files inside skyrim\'s data folder;
3. Activate Missing_houses.esp;
4. Play and see if everything works correctly.

[size=4][b]Uninstallation[/b][/size]
1. Get off the house(s) all the stuff you stored (if any);
2. Close skyrim and deactivate Missing_houses.esp;
3. Delete Missing Houses.esp and Missing Houses.bsa;
4. Play and see if everything is gone.

[size=4][b]FAQ[/b][/size]
[list]
[*]Where\'s the key to home X?
You\'ll have to purchase it just as you would purchase any other vanilla house in game, being thane of the city may or may be not a requirement (depends from the house you wish to buy).

[*]I bought a house but it\'s all empty, dark and full of cobwebs!
You\'ll have to purchase decorations from the same person you bought the house from
(it does not guarantee it\'ll make the house any less ugly, but you can always check the screenshots to see if you\'ll like it before purchasing anything).

[*]The person I bought the house from won\'t give me the decorate/upgrade options!
You have to make sure to be inside the jarl\'s longhouse to access the decorate and upgrade options. Some stewards such as Malur Seloth stay outside often, so you\'ll have to wait them to go back inside Jarl\'s longhouse to purchase any decoration or upgrade.

[*]The steward is inside Jarl\'s longhouse but I can\'t buy the house or any decoration/upgrade anyway!
Some people have reported this problem, sometimes just with a particular character, other times it won\'t work with any character, I\'m still trying to figure out and solve this problem.

[*]What\'s the difference between decoration and upgrade?
Decorations add new items to a previous empty area (and often clean that area from cobwebs and dirt in the process) while upgrades add new whole areas by expanding the house outside and of course inside which will unlock new decorations (Some are pre-decorated though), while all houses can be decored not all houses can be upgraded.

[*]Are items stored in the house safe?
Yes, they are.
You\'ll have to purchase the house from the city\'s steward to get your home in player\'s faction though.
[/list]

[size=4][b]Known bugs[/b][/size]
[list]
[*]Trinsmardia\'s door to balcony graphical error (but it works)
[*]Houses can be purchased even if you\'re not thane
[*]Quests don\'t complete after you visit your new home
[*]Trinsmardia Graphical bug on main entrance
[/list]
If you find any other bug please tell me with a comment, thanks!

[size=4][b]Special thanks[/b][/size]
[list]
[*]waxman08 - For taking the time to test my mod and tell me all the bugs, thanks!
[*]Ghaunadaur - For taking the time to test my mod, tell me all the bugs and give me various suggestions, thanks!
[*]German translation by Ghaunadaur.
[*]Paintings and Frames mod by Artisanix.
[/list]
author: Xilante
